entry.title: Onboarding Reminder Emails Settings - reminders trigger
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I am getting quite confused with the email reminders, especially when they are being triggered

If my settings are below:

Set reminder before the due date - ticked:

  •  "Frequency of reminders in days" = 3
  • "Number of reminders to be sent" = 0

 Set reminder after due date - ticked:

  •  "Frequency of reminders in days" = 3
  • "Number of reminders to be sent" = 10

Does the above result in:

Scenario: Due date of the task is 17 December  and task is assigned 1 December

  • Set reminder before the due date:

a) The reminder is sent every 3 days from the day the task is created and assigned to the user 

Scenario: Reminder email gets triggered 4th December (i.e. 3 days after the task is assigned) and every 3 days from the 4th?

OR

b) reminders start to trigger only 3 days before the due date set in Manage Data and then every 3 days leading up to the due date

Scenario: Reminder email gets from 14th (i.e. 3 days before 17 Dec due date) and then every 3 days from the 14th?

 

  •  Set reminder after due date:

a) The reminder is sent every 3 days from the day the task is due and up to 10 notifications is sent every 3 days. After 10 notifications are sent then the reminders stop even if the task is still pending for completion?

Scenario: Reminder email gets triggered 17 December and every 3 days from the 17th? OR Reminder email gets triggered 1 day after the due date so from 18 Dec and every 3 days from 18th?

@Gopinath_Murugaiyan @akarshn your expertise and advice would be greatly appreciated. Client needs clarity for testing purposes

entry.title: MDI to Planon Integration delta token not matching
entry.content:
We've recently established connection with Planon with S4 HANA Public Cloud. We've managed to push/pull some data.

Then I've tried to set up the BP resulting to recreating the MDI service instance.

After updating the credentials of impacted config, we can no longer sync to Planon. Planon says they are getting a delta token not matching error. They already tried restarting their app but still no go.

2025-12-10 17:23:48,100 [ERROR] [pnlog.APP.planonsoftware.com.planonrealestatemanagementforsap.servermodule.com.planon.sap.scheduledtask.SyncVersionIdsTask] Exception occured while executing SyncVersionIdsTask: SyncService-BTP response Code: 400, message: {"error":{"code":"DeltaTokenDoesNotMatchRequest","message":"The consuming system or requested entity type and version does not match the delta token. Please only use delta tokens in the context of one consuming system, entity type and version.","details":[]}} : com.planonsoftware.platform.backend.connector.v2.MessageDiscardException: SyncService-BTP response Code: 400, message: {"error":{"code":"DeltaTokenDoesNotMatchRequest","message":"The consuming system or requested entity type and version does not match the delta token. Please only use delta tokens in the context of one consuming system, entity type and version.","details":[]}}

What can we do with this issue?

entry.title: Goods Receipt(F0843) : Consider for Posting checked
entry.content:
Hello Members,

I use SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
I have a question regarding ”goods receipt posting”(F0843) for subcontracted materials.
Is there a setting to uncheck the "Consider for Posting" checkbox by default in the component list of a subcontracted item?

This component is an item that is not managed by inventory.
An error occurs when posting goods receipts with "Consider Posting" checked.

I want the checkbox to be unchecked by default so that I can post goods receipts without manual intervention.

I would be grateful if you could help me.
Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Re: Is there any cost involved in enabling Career site Bu...
entry.content:
Hi @praveen59 ,

There is no additional cost to enable Career Site Builder (CSB) in lower environments (Preview/Stage/TEST) as long as you already have RMK/Recruiting Marketing licensed in Production.

SAP provides CSB provisioning access for non-production instances without extra charges.
You only need to raise a request to SAP Support (or your implementation partner) to enable CSB in the lower environment from Provisioning.

Thanks,

kr,

karthick,

entry.title: SAP S/4 HANA Group Reporting 2023 - Rule based COI- Cross holding Scenario
entry.content:
HI Experts,
 
SAP Group Reporting - Rule based COI - standard rules - cross holding scenario - first consolidation 
When we are executing 2100 - COI task - system not showing up NCI calculation properly.
CU - 700X holds 99.99% in CU 700Y - 6 Crore - Equity amount
CU - 700Y holds 99.99 % in CU 7003 - 6 Crore - Equity amount
 
Manual calculation
                                      
Equity Amount - 6,00,00,000  ;  99.99% - 59999820 ; NCI Amount - 180
 
System calculation for NCI 
Equity - 6,00,00,000;  99.99%  -59999640 ; NCI - -53787827.01
 
Could you please share thoughts why NCI is not getting calculated as per our manual. 
 
Thanks.

entry.title: How can I check the subscribed license for SAP Ariba Snap Buying (8008177)
entry.content:
I would like to know how can I check within SAP4me the subscribed license for SAP Ariba Snap Buying (DIGITS) and it's current consumption


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How can I check the subscribed license for SAP Ariba...
entry.content:
To access the license material for SAP Ariba Snap Buying (8008177), follow these steps:

1.Navigate to the Portfolio & Products portal: https://me.sap.com/portfolio
2.Select the My Product Portfolio section via this link: https://me.sap.com/portfolio/portfolioproducts
3.Under the My Purchased Products list, locate SAP Ariba Snap. Click the number displayed in the Materials column next to the product.
4. This action will load the license material details page, where you can view "SAP Ariba Snap Buying (8008177)"

entry.title: S/4HANA Public Cloud - API Availability for BP Extension Fields Read, AR Payment Block Update, and P
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,
We are investigating API availability in S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition for the following three scenarios. Please answer with the specific API name if available, or clearly state if no API exists (and any alternative approaches if not possible).

Question 1: Business Partner Master Read (including Extension Fields)
・Can we retrieve BP master data including extension field values via API?
・If yes, please provide the specific API name.
・If no, please confirm that no standard API supports this and suggest any alternative approaches.


Question 2: AR Open Item - Payment Block Flag Update
・Can we toggle (set/unset) the payment block flag on AR line items via API?
・If yes, please provide the specific API name.
・If no, please confirm that no standard API supports this and suggest any alternative approaches.

Question 3: Payment Advice Document Registration
・Can we register payment advice documents via API?
・If yes, please provide the specific API name.
・If no, please confirm that no standard API supports this and suggest any alternative approaches.

Note: We would appreciate responses in the same numbered order (1→2→3) to keep the discussion clear.
Thank you in advance!

entry.title: S/4HANA Public Cloud - CDS Views Equivalent to On-Premise Tables for Sales Reconciliation Solution
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,
We are migrating an existing sales reconciliation solution from on-premise S/4HANA to S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition. We need to identify the equivalent CDS views for the following on-premise tables used in our reconciliation logic.
Please provide the specific CDS view name for each table. If key fields are known (especially for transactional data that requires joins), please include them as well.

Question 1: KNB1 (Customer Master - Company Code Data)
Equivalent CDS view name?

Question 2: BSID (AR Open Items - Customer)
Equivalent CDS view name?
Key fields for joining with other CDS views?

Question 3: BKPF (Accounting Document Header)
Equivalent CDS view name?
Key fields for joining with other CDS views?

Question 4: VBRK (Billing Document Header)
Equivalent CDS view name?
Key fields for joining with other CDS views?

Question 5: VBRP (Billing Document Item)
Equivalent CDS view name?
Key fields for joining with other CDS views?

Question 6: VBAP (Sales Order Item)
Equivalent CDS view name?

Question 7: VBPA (Sales Order Partner)
Equivalent CDS view name?

Question 8: VBAK (Sales Order Header)
Equivalent CDS view name?

Question 9: VBKD (Sales Order Business Data)
Equivalent CDS view name?

Note: We would appreciate responses in the same numbered order (1→9) to keep the discussion clear.
Thank you in advance!

entry.title: SAP BPC 10.1 ICDATA
entry.content:
Dear ALL Experts,

I'm working on SAP BPC NW version 10.1. SP06

We are building the IC Matching Report as per instructed, but it always returned with "0 Submitted, 0 Success, 0 Fail".

Below please find a checklist with what I have done:

 

1. Account dimension : i have maintained two accounts with parent matching account and two more accunts ICDIFF1, ICDIFF2 under ICDIFF0

2 . Maintained Retation between ENTITY and INTCO  by relational integrity 

2.. In AuditTrail Dimension, I have added a field called "IC_ORIGINE" and added 4 members "Credit1","Credit2","Debit1","Debit2", with "C","C2","D","D2" value assigned to "IC_ORIGINE".

  My questios is , is it C1 C2 D1 D2 or C,D C1,D1

3. I Need to apply Default logic to get reconciliation records while loading from BW to BPC  so DATAsrc=ECC  I am hardcoding.

3. I have a script logic ICDATA with content as below:

     *RUN_PROGRAM ICDATA  (is it ICDATA or ICBOOKING)

     CATEGORY = %CATEGORY_SET%

     CURRENCY = HKD

     DATAsrc=  ECC   

     TID_RA = %TIME_SET%

     ENTITY = %ENTITY_SET%

     TYPE = 'I'.

     *ENDRUN_PROGRAM

entry.title: euBP in Germany: Generating a Certificate File in Germany’s ITSG Trust Center Portal
entry.content:
• Introduction
  • About ITSG
  • Registration at ITSG Trust Center Portal
  • Step 1 Enter Subscriber Number
  • Step 2 Enter Personal Data of Contact Person
  • Step 3 Confirm Email Address
  • Step 4 Start Identity Verification
  • Step 5 Complete Identity Verification
  • Step 6 Confirm Company Address
  • Step 7 Select Billing Address and Delivery
  • Step 8 Registration as a Collection Center
  • Step 9 Certificate Request Inbound Check
  • Generation of Electronic Keys
  • Submitting the Files to the Trust Center
  • Inbound Check of Certificate Request
  • Step 10 Enter a Tagging Code
  • Transferring Certified Participant Keys and Activation
  • Configuring the Key Data and Certificate File in SAP BTP Cockpit

Note:  The steps and processes described here are accurate as of the time of writing, but it's essential to stay updated with any changes on the ITSG portal that may affect this procedure. Detailed description in German can be found here: https://www.itsg.de/wp-content/uploads/Trust-Center-Registrierungsportal.pdf 

Introduction

In this blog post, I will guide you through the process of generating a certificate file in ITSG Trust Center portal using POSTIDENT. This certificate is essential for establishing a connection between the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition (hereafter referred to as the "cloud edition") and the German pension insurance authority's system. This will allow you to submit the required financial accounting data from your business system SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition integrated with the cloud edition to the pension insurance authority's system. The requirement is also known as euBP, an abbreviation of the local name Elektronisch unterstützte Betriebsprüfung, or "electronically supported company audit" in English.

About ITSG

ITSG, which stands for Information technology service point of the statutory health insurance GmbH, operates the ITSG Trust Center to create and manage certificates and facilitate secure electronic data exchange in the health and social services sectors. 

Registration at ITSG Trust Center Portal

Access the registration portal of the ITSG Trust Center using the address https://registrierungsportal.itsg.de/regportal/client/de/login . For a new activity, choose the "Register" button and for an existing activity, choose the "Log On" button.

Log on the portal

Step 1 Enter Subscriber Number

First enter the company number, the special sender number or the paying office number for the application as a unique participant number that is to be used in electronic data exchange.

Enter subscriber number

Step 2 Enter Personal Data of Contact Person

The entry of the personal data of the contact person is divided into two areas: contact data and logon data.

Enter contact data

 

 

Enter logon data

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Note: The first name and last name of the contact person must be entered in full according to the valid German identity card, valid German passport or the official identity cards and passport corresponding to the German identity card. If the name is incomplete or deviates, this leads to a rejection in the registration portal during identity verification after a POSTIDENT procedure.

Step 3 Confirm Email Address

After entering the contact data and logon data, a confirmation e-mail is sent to the specified e-mail address with an activation link for confirmation.

confirmation page

After confirmation, the logon can be performed with the logon data.

Logon after confirmation

Step 4 Start Identity Verification

The contact person must use the registration portal to carry out identification with a POSTIDENT procedure at Deutsche Post AG. The postal identification variant is only possible in Germany. Alternatively, online identification function with online ID function is supported, nut only a German identity card with activated electronic identity (eID) is permitted. 

More information can be found: https://www.deutschepost.de/de/p/postident/privatkunden/faq.html

Identity verification

Step 5 Complete Identity Verification

After the identification has been carried out using a POSTIDENT procedure, the registration portal checks the electronic confirmation from the POSTIDENT system to determine whether the first names and last names entered in step 2 (possibly also double names and titles for last names) match completely and in the sequence specified in the identification documentation. 

Complete identity verification

 After successful identification, you must log on to the registration portal again to continue the further steps. If the identity verification was not completed successfully, you can start a new registration with a new identification using the “Restart Registration” button.

Step 6 Confirm Company Address

The applicant's address is checked against lists of the issuing agencies and must then be confirmed by the contact person. If the displayed address is correct and current, click the “Address is correct” button to proceed to the next step. At the end of the certification, an activation code for activating the security module is sent to the assigned company address of the applicant.


If your company is based outside Germany, you have the option of selecting the country here. As a contact person, you can also enter your name and, for example, manually add department to the displayed address of the applicant.

If the displayed address does not correspond to the actual company address of the applicant, a generated release letter cannot be delivered correctly later in the registration process. In this case, please arrange your adjustment of the company address at the issuing agency for your trading partner number.

Step 7 Select Billing Address and Delivery

By default, your invoice will use the previously confirmed applicant company address from step 6. If the invoice is to be sent to a different billing address, use a different billing address and enter the billing address. 

Use a different billing address

 Enter address

As an alternative, you can choose a delivery by e-mail. To do this, set a checkmark for "Use electronic delivery of invoice" and specify the e-mail address.

Electronic delivery

Step 8 Registration as a Collection Center

Optionally, you can register as a reporting office to transfer notifications for other company numbers in the employer procedure or for other institute indicators in the service provider procedure.

Step 9 Certificate Request Inbound Check

The registration portal checks in the background whether the applicant has submitted a technical certificate request that was created using the security module to the Trust Center. The execution of this step is divided into the three substeps: Generation of Electronic Keys, Transfer of Files to Trust Center, and Receipt Check of Certificate Request.

Generation of Electronic Keys

A GUID transaction number (GUID for short) is now assigned, which is used as a reference between the data in the registration portal and the technical data for generating the certificate from the applicant's system. The GUID consists of 36 characters. It is recommend that you use a technically supported copy and paste of the characters to avoid spelling errors or character shifts.

GUID

 Working with the Separate Security Module

The security module is essential for applying for the electronic certificate at the ITSG Trust Center. This operation on the applicant's system is not supported by the registration portal. Therefore, you're recommended to actively log off the registration portal. Otherwise, the logoff takes place automatically.

In the security module, the key data for generating the electronic key pair (consisting of the public and private key) of the applicant must be entered manually and a certificate must be applied for. This key data must clearly match the request data entered in the registration portal. 

The following are the key data required:

· Participant number - alternatively, company number, special sender number, paying office number, etc.

· Applicant Name (Company Name)

· Contact Full Name

After entering the required information, the security module generates the key pair (consisting of public and private key) with the hash code of the request key required for certification (public key of the participant in the request file). The private key remains in the IT system of the applicant.

The generated request key is stored by the security module in a so-called Request file (p10 format) to check the hash code by the contact person for a match in a subsequent request step (example extract of a hash code: E1D07A4B.….FC781).

The security module generates a so-called safety module. Hash code file (pdf format) with the hash code in SHA256 format. This contains the following information for a unique assignment:

  • The participant number - alternatively, company number, test company number, sender number, paying office number, etc.
  • Name of the company (company name)
  • Contact Name
  • Hash Code of Request Key (SHA256 Format)

Submitting the Files to the Trust Center

After the security module has generated the electronic key and a PDF file with the hash code has been saved, the two files must be transferred to the Trust Center with the request file (for example, 12345678.p10) and the hash code. The transfer of the files to the Trust Center depends on the selected request form and the supported functions in the used software (with or without OSTC online interface).

If the software used does not support the OSTC online interface of the Trust Center, you must manually transfer the two files with the request file and the hash code (PDF file) to the trust center. Optionally, a self-declaration for a reporting office (PDF file) can be transferred in addition to the request.

Initial applications without OSTC online interface

Call up the Web address https://www.itsg-trust.de/zap/home in a browser.

Initial application without OSTC interface

 To uniquely assign the files to be transferred, you must specify the GUID transaction number (see substep Generation of Electronic Keys). After this, the three files are transferred to the Trust Center. The portal confirms the successful transfer with an internal transaction number (e.g. UP123456). 

  • Request File
  • Hash Code File
  • Self-declaration reporting office (optional) 

Initial application or online subsequent application via the OSTC online interface
For an online application using the OSTC online interface, all required application data and components (without self-declaration reporting office) are transferred automatically using the online interface. Only the GUID transaction number generated by the registration portal must be entered manually in the security module. 

After execution, the applicant receives an online order number from the OSTC system, e.g. OE123456 for online initial application or e.g. OF123456 for an online follow-up application.

Inbound Check of Certificate Request

After you have successfully transferred your files to the ITSG Trust Center either via the upload portal or the OSTC online interface, the registration portal checks in the background whether you have transferred your file with the certificate request to the Trust Center with the corresponding GUID.

The transferred request file that contains the public key of the participant key is compared with the content of the hash code file during the inbound check by the Trust Center. After receiving the request file and the hash code file, the registration portal provides the Trust Center with the complete application data for the final check. If you have logged out of the registration portal or have been automatically logged out, you will need to log in again.

Inbound check

 After a successful check from the registration portal that the certificate request with the corresponding GUID was transmitted to the Trust Center, the registration is automatically taken to the last step 10 and a release letter is sent.

Step 10 Enter a Tagging Code

After submitting the complete certificate application, the applicant receives and must complete the registration process by entering a release code in the registration portal.

The letter sent by the Trust Center to the applicant contains an activation code and the hash code of the key submitted for certification. Once the release letter has been received, the contact person or an authorized representative of the applicant must log on to the registration portal again. First, the hash code of the certification application must be visually checked for compliance with the release letter. You can then enter the activation code to complete the registration.

Enter activation code

 The Trust Center now certifies the public key transmitted by the applicant and also transfers this key to the corresponding public directories of the Trust Center. As a result, the applicant is activated as a participant in electronic data exchange with employers or electronic data exchange with service providers.

You can use the participant number and the order number on the page https://www.itsg- trust.de/all/oav.php  to register for online application tracking and view the status of your certification application.

Transferring Certified Participant Keys and Activation 

The certified public key of the applicant is stored in a certificate file (e.g. B. 12345678.p7c) for the transfer. The contact person is informed by e-mail.

The certificate file is available for download via the online application tracking on the page https://www.itsg-trust.de/all/oav.php . The transfer of the certified key must be triggered manually by the applicant.

Configuring the Key Data and Certificate File in SAP BTP Cockpit

When you configure the communication settings between your business system SAP S4/HANA Cloud Public Edition and the German pension insurance authority's system, you need to enter the key data (such as company number or sender number) as identification number. When configuring the authentication settings, the certificate file should be uploaded.

Communication setting

Authentication Setting

For more information, see the documentation Integration with a Service for Electronic Submission on the SAP Help Portal.

I hope you find this information helpful. If you have any further questions, feel free to leave a comment on this blog post or discover more information in the following documentation:

  • German euBP Files 
  • Managing Communication Settings 
  • Process-Specific Settings

entry.title: Fiori Element - Intent-Based Navigation adds unwanted query parameters and navigates to input screen
entry.content:
Intent-Based Navigation appends unwanted parameters and navigates to input screen instead of target display screen

Hello Team,

We are facing an issue with Intent-Based Navigation (IBN) for a custom semantic object/action used to open a standard display screen.

We are using an annotation structured as follows (generic form):

{
  "$Type": "UI.DataFieldWithIntentBasedNavigation",
  "SemanticObject": "SomeSemanticObject",
  "Action": "displayDocuments",
  "Value": "SomePrimaryProperty",
  "RequiresContext": true,
  "Inline": true,
  "Label": "{i18n>SomeLabel}",
  "Mapping": [
    { "LocalProperty": "PropertyA", "SemanticObjectProperty": "FieldA" },
    { "LocalProperty": "PropertyB", "SemanticObjectProperty": "FieldB" },
    { "LocalProperty": "PropertyC", "SemanticObjectProperty": "FieldC" },
    { "LocalProperty": "PropertyD", "SemanticObjectProperty": "FieldD" }
  ]
}
 

This configuration works correctly when only one mapping is provided. However, when multiple mappings are used, the IBN behavior changes unexpectedly.

Issue Observed

  1. When the IBN link is triggered, the navigation does not directly open the target display screen. Instead, it opens the initial input screen, requiring manual entry.
  2. The generated URL becomes excessively long because it includes many unrelated Object Page fields, not just the mapped ones.
  3. This issue occurs only when multiple entries exist in the Mapping array.

Example of the actual URL generated (redacted and simplified):

https://<launchpad-url>#SomeSemanticObject-displayDocuments?FieldA=...&FieldB=...&FieldC=...&FieldD=...&[hundreds of automatically-added parameters]
 

Expected Behavior

The URL should include only the explicitly mapped properties, such as:

https://<launchpad-url>#SomeSemanticObject-displayDocuments?FieldA=...&FieldB=...&FieldC=...&FieldD=...
 

No additional Object Page fields should be appended.

Impact

  • Navigation lands on the wrong screen (input instead of display).
  • Extremely long URLs due to appended parameters.
  • Behavior suggests a framework-level issue, not annotation misuse.

Request for Support

We kindly request confirmation on the following:

  • Is this a known issue or limitation in the Fiori IBN framework when multiple mappings are used?
  • Is there a workaround to ensure only mapped parameters are included in the URL?
  • Can the framework behavior be corrected so that navigation proceeds directly to the target display screen?

Any guidance or assistance in resolving this issue would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Warehouse Management - Clear Negative Stock from 902 Stype
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I would like to request your assistance and guidance regarding an issue we are facing with negative stock appearing in storage type 902 due to a user error.

Scenario Overview:

  1. A Purchase Order was created with line item 10 (Material ABCX) and a PO quantity of 10.
  2. An inbound delivery was created, and the PGR was posted successfully. In the PO history, the 101 movement type with the material document is completed.
  3. The issue occurred when a second inbound delivery was mistakenly created and received with a quantity of 20, resulting in an additional 101 movement.
  4. Upon realizing the error, the user attempted to reverse the second material document, which posted a 102 movement.
  5. After this reversal, negative stock remains in storage type 902 under both “Stock for Putaway” and “Pick Quantity” columns. Please refer to the attachment.

Additional Notes:

The Purchase Order has no remaining open quantity to receive (Still to be Delivered = 0).  I checked LB13 and LT24 and found no open transfer orders or documents that can be processed.

At this point, I am looking for guidance on how to clear or flush out the negative stock from storage type 902 caused by this human error. I would greatly appreciate any advice, recommended steps, or corrective actions.

Thank you in advance for your support.

entry.title: Re: MM_Classification or serial numbers
entry.content: The structure of the NSN says what it means. So you have to identify the NSN of a 9 mm weapon and then search with the correspondent part of the number.

entry.title: Re: SAP Analytics Cloud, add-in for Microsoft Excel - New high-volume mode
entry.content:
We should set aside the assumption that customers will not use planning layouts exceeding one million cells.
In fact, the more advanced and sophisticated the management capabilities of a customer are, the more complex their planning layouts tend to be often far beyond what we think.
We have already experienced cases where SAC could not accommodate customer requirements involving planning layouts of more than one million cells, and we ultimately had to propose BPC instead.
While there are still some limitations today particularly in planning, I Hope continuous improvements going forward.

I have a requirement of sending HR masterdata via HRMD_A message type. I have configured most of the part and data is being sent.
One of my requirement is, I wat to send data based on change pointers. i.e. data should be sent for those employees who have been changed since last run. It is working fine too. But it is only sending changed data. I want all infotypes segments to be sent when I run program RHALESMD to send idocs for change pointers. 
Any idea on how to achieve this?

Regards
Param

entry.title: Re: MM_Classification or serial numbers
entry.content:
NATO Stock Numbers don't provide exact weapon caliber, only caliber range - List of NATO Supply Classification Groups - Group 10: Weapons 

My point is that NATO Stock Number is not an answer to the original question. It doesn't cover all the requirements.

entry.title: Output Management - How to send emails to mail-addresses from BUR001 relationship
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

in our scenario we have integrated S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition with Sales Cloud V2. As stated in that KBA, V2 is not able to display the email-address of the business partner in the UI. To see and use the email addresses in V2, they have to be replicated via the relationships. Therefore we would have to maintain it on relationship-level in S/4.

The challenge we're facing is: In S/4 we need the email address on Business Partner level for the use in Output Management (we're using Y partner functions to send emails to the Contact Persons). 

To summarize: In V2 we need the mail addresses in another place than in S/4...

Has anyone an idea, if we could use a CDS-View in S/4 to use the mail-address from the relationship in Output Management? I know there's a BAdI APOC_ADD_EMAIL_RECIPIENTS which might help.

BR Tobi

entry.title: Customize emails for e-invoices sent via DRC Cloud Edition
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

we have integrated SAP DRC Cloud Edition with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

We want to send out e-invoices (ZUGFeRD) via email. The scenario works and the invoice is sent out.

But we would like to customize the email (subject, body) that is sent out (like we could do for other invoices that are sent out via Output Management directly from Public Cloud).

Does anybody know if that is even possible and if so, how?

BR Tobi

My requirement is to have that same app available in a SAP Partner Demo Customizing tenant. Is this possible? and what's the best way to achieve this?

Thanks,

entry.title: manifest.json not picking yocc based extension
entry.content:
I created new webservice extension using yocc accelerator (say - testocc). It is working fine in local machines and I'm able to access all ootb endpoints with /occ/v2. but when we deploy it on ccv2 cloud, they are not accessible.

I doubt it's manifest.json which is not having correct entries. Can you please help resolve this issue.

My SAP Commerce cloud version is 2211.43.
These are my manifest entries for this new extension:

"useConfig": {
   "extensions": {
     "location": "config/localextensions.xml",
     ...
]
"aspects": [
   {
   "name": "backoffice",
   "webapps": [
   ...
   {
   "name": "commercewebservices",
   "contextPath": "/occ"
   }
]
},
{
   "name": "api",
   "webapps": [
   ...
   {
     "name": "commercewebservices",
     "contextPath": "/occ"
   }
]

Note: I have also tried replacing commercewebservices with testocc in menifest, but that also didn't work.

entry.title: Re: Customize emails for e-invoices sent via DRC Cloud Ed...
entry.content:
Hi Tobi,

I had exactly the same issue. SAP does not provide an e-mail template for e-invoices like it does for the regular invoices sent via Output Management.

We solved it by implementing the BAdI _EDOC_PART_CONN_CHANGE_MAIL. With this BAdI you can add your own e-mail template text.

Hope that helps!

Best regards
David
